newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL- Nokia climbs on earnings.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL- Nokia climbs on earnings.

text.p: The U.S.-listed shares in Finnish telecommunications group Nokia Ab rallied preceding the market open Tuesday on news of strong first quarter results, traders said.
In pre-open third market trade, Nokia climbed to 61-3/8 from last night's New York Stock Exchange close of 57-3/4, according to traders.

In related buying, Telefon AB L.M. Ericsson's Nasdaq-listed American Depositary Receipts rose to 31-3/4 from 30-13/16 and Motorola Inc was bid up at 56-3/8, above last night's 55-3/8 NYSE close, they said.
Earlier, Nokia announced pre-tax first quarter profits of 1.45 billion markka or US$278.7 million, near the top of the analysts' forecast range, versus 399 million markka one year ago.
Elsewhere, Symantec shares increased 3/4 to 13-1/2, a move also powered by positive earnings news.

After last night's market close, Symantec reported fiscal fourth quarter operating earnings of $0.30 per share, $0.04 above the Zack's Investment Research analysts' consensus forecast and better than the $0.18 reported one year ago.
